definition: to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)

sentences.english: I think it's easy to get sucked into one of the chains.
sentences.chinese: 我想很容易就牵扯上其中的一家连锁店了。

sentences.english: As pharmacy chains face squeezes on profit margins, the use of techs is growing.
sentences.chinese: 配药连锁店由于利润幅度紧缩，使用的技工越来越多。

sentences.english: She had eaten a hamburger at a California fast-food chain.
sentences.chinese: 她在加利福尼亚的快餐连锁店吃了一个汉堡。

sentences.english: Note: Systembolaget is a government owned chain of liquor stores in Sweden.
sentences.chinese: 这是政府拥有的酒类连锁店。

sentences.english: Now it has more than 30 restaurants in the city.
sentences.chinese: 如今，永和在上海的连锁店已超过30家。

sentences.english: There are many chain stores in Dalin, which one do you want to go?
sentences.chinese: 大连有多家这中连锁店，你要去哪家？

sentences.english: The reception among food distributors and buyers for store chains has been favorable, he said.
sentences.chinese: 他说，食品批发商以及连锁店进货商对他们看好。

sentences.english: These dumplings come courtesy of a Taiwanese restaurant chain called Din Tai Fung No matter.
sentences.chinese: 现在经手的是台湾一家名叫鼎泰丰的连锁店。

sentences.english: Tenfu's Tea is the biggest tea chain store in China .
sentences.chinese: 天福茗茶是中国最大的茶叶销售连锁店。
便利连锁店做得很不错。

sentences.english: Mama cate is a Chinese fast food chain.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈饭香是一家中式快餐连锁店。

sentences.english: She sued6 Harco Drugs, Inc. , the regional chain where the mistake was made.
sentences.chinese: 她起诉了造成错误的地区性连锁店哈克药品公司。

sentences.english: Housing rental chain after a certain agency fees charged to the owner.
sentences.chinese: 房屋出租后连锁店向房主收取一定的代理费。

sentences.english: Sandwich-chain Subway is expanding quickly in China.
sentences.chinese: 三明治连锁店赛百味在中国扩张迅速。

sentences.english: A national woman's clothing catalog tried something out a few year ago.
sentences.chinese: 一家全国性的女装连锁店几年前发明了一个新花招。

sentences.english: Many storekeepers are finding they can't compete against the large chain stores.
sentences.chinese: 不少零售商发现自己没有能力和大型连锁店竞争。

definition: brick and mortar business/physical (rather than online) retail store
